name: ScreenFX
tagline: A plugin library for JavaFX 8 adding features for resizing and arranging stage windows for multiple screens
body:
### Editor's note This tool is inspired originally by the tool "Asus Multiframe" which was only capable to handle two screens. ### Requirements This library is written for JavaFX 8 and was built with JDK 1.8.0-b121. If you compile the sources with JDK 1.7 it could mabye work 100% without any trouble. ### How it works? ### How to use? The installation of ScreenFX is very easy. All you need is to call: 
Button button = new Button("Show ScreenFX");
ScreenFX screenFX = new ScreenFX();
screenFX.install(button);
If you want more access to ScreenFX you can adjust some properties (as listed in the features list): 
Button button = new Button("Show ScreenFX");
Properties sfxProperties = ScreenFX.getScreenFXProperties();
sfxProperties.put("UIConventionOverride", new Boolean(false));
sfxProperties.put("allowTooltips", new Boolean(true));
sfxProperties.put("exitDelayTime", new Long(200l));
sfxProperties.put("popupKeyCodeCombination", new KeyCodeCombination(KeyCode.D, KeyCombination.SHIFT_DOWN));
screenFX.setScreenFXProperties(sfxProperties);
screenFX.install(button);
![ ](http://image-upload.de/image/3Bq9nR/384acc8dba.png) ![ ](http://image-upload.de/image/CyzLs8/8a2f142ed9.png) ![ ](http://image-upload.de/image/LYPK5Z/20203b1f6e.png) ![ ](http://image-upload.de/image/sRjc2Q/47894edb35.png) ![ ](http://image-upload.de/image/NEe4sB/6eae86a6d4.png) ![ ](http://image-upload.de/image/GymRZL/51ff5c1635.png) ![ ](http://image-upload.de/image/NwIPzY/f170eaedaf.png) ![ ](http://image-upload.de/image/6kWHVC/afa4d056b9.png) ![ ](http://image-upload.de/image/PhLADc/1e51a41326.png) ### Features * compatible up to 9 screens (cubic layout, master screen in middle of cube) * language support german + english * should be compatible with all operating systems (tested only Windows 7/8/8.1) * includes calculations for maximum real screen size or the screen size respecting elements like windows taskbar which reduce the area for resizing windows * global configuration options which are: * change key combination * enable/disable tooltips * enable/disable overriding of ui conventions (if enabled you can resize the window even it is in fullscreen mode) * add custom icon set * add custom language resource * change the delay time to exit ScreenFX when moving mouse out * configuration is global so you can access one static class to controll all the ScreenFX containers * for each stage you can allow an own ScreenFX container separately * resize window to screen halfs or quarters * put window to screen edges or corners * set to fullscreen * maximize window in width, height or both * jump the window to each screen you want * access ScreenFX through key combination (default: ctrl + s) or via button pressing (you need a JavaFX component which extends the class ButtonBase) * you do not need to initialize the tool manually. you only have to install the tool once per stage. therefore minimum requirement is that the stage contains a minimum of one node ### To do ### License
